list_definition.definition: a kind of pottery coarser than china

list_ex_of_english: Verni weavers employ the image of birds and animals in simple geometrical shapes, imitating the earthenware patterns that were popular in prehistoric times.
We are now producing earthenware which is translucent.
In the case of pottery they singled out earthenware.
There is no shortage of plastic or earthenware crockery for replacement, and restaurants should be told not to serve food in cracked crockery.
We produce earthenware—an entirely different article.
I know the restaurants which have earthenware carafes so that customers cannot see how much wine they contain.
Inside were found an earthenware bowl and a small ceramic vessel and three shells that had been perforated to use as jewellery.
The male has a distinctive boss at the end of the snout, which resembles an earthenware pot known as "ghara".
